landlord_tenant_relationship.reasoning: Adequately pleaded: Complaint alleges a residential tenancy beginning January 15, 2022, rent payments of $1,200/month, and that Defendant is the owner/landlord of the Premises (¶¶1–5, 3).

act_or_omission_by_landlord.reasoning: Adequately pleaded: Plaintiff alleges Defendant arranged an electrician but has acknowledged the need for substantial repair, is “getting quotes,” has delayed work, and has not restored electricity or provided a timeline (¶¶8–11, 14). These allegations describe affirmative responses plus the landlord's omission/failure to complete necessary repairs.

substantial_interference.reasoning: Adequately pleaded: The complaint alleges one of two bedrooms has lacked electricity for ~six weeks, rendering the bedroom unusable (it was used as a home office), forcing Plaintiff to work elsewhere and incur recurring expenses, and materially impairing use of the living area (¶¶6–7, 12–13, 18). Those facts plausibly allege a deprivation of beneficial use sufficient to constitute substantial interference.

causation.reasoning: Adequately pleaded: Complaint links Defendant’s knowledge and failure to repair (¶¶8–11, 14) to the lack of electricity and the resulting loss of use and expenses, alleging the damages are a direct and proximate result of the condition and Defendant’s inaction (¶¶12, 20, 21).

damages.reasoning: Adequately pleaded: Plaintiff specifies actual out‑of‑pocket damages of $720 (coffee shop and coworking expenses), and also alleges inconvenience, loss of exclusive possession of part of the premises, and diminution of use (¶¶12–13, 15, 20–21).
